correctAnswer.answer: It is the intersection of 2-3 sets

covid-Vis-question-1.instruction: Please answer the following question about the plot:

response.prompt: How many sets are shown in the upset plot?
How many sets are shown in the upset plot?
What is the largest intersection?
response.secondaryText: Select all Sets in the Intersection

response.prompt: How large is the largest intersection?
How many sets make up the largest intersection?
options: It is only of a single set
It is the intersection of 2-3 sets
It is the intersection of many sets
It is the empty intersection (no sets)

response.prompt: How similar are the set sizes?

options.label: Roughly equal (all the set sizes look similar)
Diverging a bit (the sizes of the largest set and the smallest set don't differ largely)
Diverging a lot (the sizes of the largest set and the smallest set differ largely)

response.prompt: Is the largest set present in the largest intersection?
Is the all-set intersection (intersection having all the sets) present?
How confident are you in your answers?
response.secondaryText: 1 = Not at all confident, 5 = Very confident

response.prompt: How well did you understand the information presented?
response.secondaryText: 1 = Not at all understood, 5 = Completely understood

response.prompt: How effective was the plot at conveying information?
response.secondaryText: 1 = Not at all effective, 5 = Extremely effective

covid-Vis-question-3.instruction: Please answer the following question about the chart:

response.prompt: What are your insights and take-aways from this plot for this data?
response.secondaryText: 1 = Not at all confident, 5 = Very confident

correctAnswer.answer: It is the intersection of many sets
